6 meters away from the phone.

Good form some weeks, since them I am getting tired of the bad customer service.
I bought the item in July 2015 and started using it some weeks after.
In November on a trip to Japan the right speaker suddenly failed.
Since then IO am contacting Bose and getting one automated reply after another.
It is now Feb 29th 2016, and I still have a broken headset.... Just unbelievable.
As I am on the road I cannot afford to go and listen to hoyurs of music.
For a high end product like Bose I had expected a better customer service.
So what shall I do?
Buy another Bose QC25?
At the risk it might also die on me and have another broken headset in my luggage?

this works AWESOME only complaint is that the 'hang up' button on the cord is very sensitive and I have to watch that I don't lean on it while talking because I'll hang up on whoever I am talking to.

People on other end say they hear me clearly.
Fits comfortable and is very adjustable I would highly recommend :)
Bought as a gift.
Great item.
Quick delivery.
I had a couple of challenges hooking them up, but that had as much to do with the receiver as the headphones.
The important thing to me was that they have plenty of volume.
My hearing stinks after a tour in VN.
I can't opine on the nuances of the quality of the sound because of that hearing.
They are hooked up to the "center" speaker output so I get to actually hear the dialogue and not the music.
It seems like every movie and TV program these days have background music so d---ed loud one would think it was an MTV music video!
They squeeze my generous size head but the band will probably stretch with time.
These headphones are the lightest I've ever used (only 2.5 ounces).
The sound is stellar, with the highs and lows represented very well.
Volume can be cranked up to extremes without any distortion.
However, these do leak sound because of their design.
You would need to turn them pretty high for anybody else to hear anything.
Good all around general headphones.
The sound is fairly decent and I had no issues pairing it to my phone through the setup process.
Some reviewers have notated it is slightly bulky, but once it the ear it really is not that big of a deal especially since there is nothing else but the band.
I will use these for travel since they are easy to pack away and can double up as workout headphones.
I received these headphones at a discounted rate in exchange for an unbiased review.
I mean, you get what you pay for.

They're perfectly working wireless headphones, sound quality is of course not great, design is terrible, the bluetooth functionality is a little weird (they keep switching names, I have to unpair and pair every time I use them) and the button on the outside rattles a lot, making a really loud noise right in your earhole.
They're cheap as hell, they're great as a backup pair, or if you're broke and really want some wireless headphones to listen to music whilst eating ramen noodles.
Plus, I mean, Zivago just sounds kind of cool.
"What kind of headphones are those man?"
"Oh these?
They're ZIVAGO."
Right?
They fit very well in my ears.
The sound is incredible!
Very nice product.
They have rubber ear inserts that fit very well and are not uncomfortable at all.
They also include a few different sizes of the rubber so you can find a size that fits your ear.
The cord is nice and light but seems durable and will hold up over time.
The color is really nice as well.
I have used them to talk hands free and no one has had a problem hearing me and I can hear the other caller just fine.
I really like these headphones.
I am using them on my iPhone 6s and they work and fit great.
Connection drops if you put it in your pocket which makes these pretty useless.
I'd buy something else
I purchase these to work with my IPhone.
The ear peace can swivel and adjust in length to fix most ears, this allows them to fit comfortably.
The pairing is easy and I was not able to pair them with more then one device.
I was able to use them for over an hour and a half while jogging and talking on the phone with little or no issues.
The battery life of last was around 50% after an hour and a half.
I did find one negative think is you have to have the blue tooth turn on your device prior to turning on these hear phones, but this could be normal for all blue tooth head phones.
These are cute earbuds!
The gold cord is very different from the usual white cords you regularly see.
Where the cord attaches to the plug in is reinforced, so I can see that being awesome for the long-term life of this item.
Note that there is no mic or sound adjustment on the iBuds themselves, so that is why I gave it a 4-star review.
It comes with 2 each of 3 different sizes of ear fittings, so it is excellent to have spares.
They also came with a beautiful gold embossed pouch to store the iBuds in, which will be nice for leaving them in my purse.
Overall, I like these as an accessory and a backup for my Bluetooth earbuds.
I received this product at a discount for my unbiased review.
These headphones sounds great, but they are so poorly balanced that they kept falling out of my ears.
No matter which tip I tried, there wasn't enough of a snug fit to counter the weight of the earpiece itself.
I had such high-hopes....
I've tried so many different in-ear headphones, and I would definitely rate these as amongst the worst.
Bluetooth connectivity starts clear but degrades and gets choppy after 35 minutes of play.
Disconnecting / reconnecting the bluetooth didn't improve the issue.
A headphone recharge fixed the issue but only for another 30 minutes of play.
I wish the playtime was advertised with this product.
Thankfully the headphones work fine cabled but the bassboost only works when running bluetoothed.
Sound quality is accurate and clear running cabled and without the boost.
Fitment is also comfortable with the thick cushions but to compare with other headphones, this isn't the smallest nor largest in the over-the-ear audio.
As a corded headphone, this is a decent choice.
If you're looking for a bluetooth headphone, pass on these unless you're okay with the limited 30 min playtime.
I have purchased two sets of this item over the past 3 years, one in Nov 2013 and one in Oct 2015.
Both times have resulted in the same experience.
The music quality is impeccable.
The sound is clear and crisp that can be compared to an apple headset.
The downside is that each pair I've owned has malfunction solely because the cord detaches at the end where the plug goes into the phone jack.

I loved this set so much that I purchased them again even after experiencing this with the first pair thinking that this issue would have resolved itself over the course of 2 years, I was wrong and fortunately I think I purchased a warranty this time around.
Unfortunately, I don't see where to redeem the warranty as the window for return has passed.
Hopefully I can locate the MA soon.
Needless to say, until they can rectify this simple defect, I cannot in good conscience, recommend these for purchase.

Don't know whether it's the plug-in, the wires going into the speaker, or the speaker itself.
Either way, one speaker is worthless for listening to music.

I love this!
The small one fits my ear.

Used my AmEx points to buy these.
Worth the expenditure.
Comfortable and clear sound.
Use them during my walks.
The sound quality is good.
They are light weight and fit fairly comfortable on the head.
The sound quality is good, and when listening to music, it blocks out enough outside noise.
My biggest issue is phone calls.
Any call I place all I hear is the ambient noise around me.
The caller is barely audible behind the other sound.
It's like the headphones pick up everything around me and let me hear this, rather than the person I'm actually trying to talk to.
It's very annoying and beyond frustrating.
For describing "clearer calls" and HD voice with adaptive audio adjustments, I found this to be false.
I do not recommend this product of you ever plan on making a phone call.
These earbuds are the best for the money.
No separate parts, good sound, very durable, very inexpensive.
My daughter loves it so much that she asks to wear them on her head even when it's not plugged into her tablet.
Great noise killer for high volumes as well.
Zealsounds love for music and concern for the enviroment gave birth to the HDE 300 earphones.
While the name doesnt exactly roll off the tongue, I like to call them the Zealsound Woodies.
They are an affordable pair of earphones with a rustic wooden design, intended for mobile use.
With simple packaging and accessories using recycled or environmentally-friendly materials, its refreshing to see a company focused on reducing environmental impact.
Equipped with an 8.5mm dynamic driver, they put out a lot of bass, and with the 1 button remote, bass notes can be put on hold when receiving or rejecting a phone call.
Skipping and rewinding is a breeze whether your on an iOS or Android device, making the Zealsound Woodies, a practical option for the environmental conscious buyer.
They don't work on Droid Phone.
And the charge is hit or miss.
One works...or only works for ten minutes... the other doesn't charge.
The sound indicators are confusing so you can't really tell when the device is on Bluetooth connect/pairing mode or its on or its off.
Just a bit hard to figure out.
Great headphones.
Packaging was awesome and headphones were in intact condition.
The sound quality is great; no unusually high bass.
Overall great for the price you pay.
Only weird thing is the volume slider on the mic; it's innovative but seems like a ticking bomb which might screw the earbuds.
Also as FYI the volume slider is stand alone i.e.
even if you have phone/pc volume on high and mic volume slider on negative (-) then there will be no sound slider does not affect the sound settings of peripheral to which headphones are connected.
Anyhow it's great buy for the price!
I have been looking for wireless headphones for awhile.
I tried headphones in store and I wasn't impressed.
I did alot of online research and decided to purchase Bluedio A.
When I received the Bluedio A, I was super excited.
I liked the look and feel of the headphones.
However, I had a difficult time pairing them with my IPhone 6 Plus.
Initially, I thought the sound quality was poor with little to no bass.
After I activated the 3D surround sound, the sound quality and bass improved but the volume level was lacking.
My $17.99 Skullcandy headphones were louder than the Bluedio A.
At that point, I decided to return them.
If not for the good audio quality, I would have given these earbuds a single star.
The right ear gave out in less than one month of light, gingerly use.
I had read about the poor quality but decided to give them a try.
I used the utmost care in handling them.
They performed very well.
I carefully rolled them into their case.
Three days later I went to use them at my work desk and the right ear didn't transmit any audio.
Not even static.
Biggest issue I have with these is the body of the set and the cans squeak and moan while on your head, and it comes through into the sound when listening to music.
I don't recall any other headphones doing this, and I have many sets from over the ear, on ear and in ear.
We bought these as a Xmas gift and the band broke because the screw holes had failed.
Noontec replace them no questions asked!
Now the new pair has poor connectivity.
Other than that .. X
These has been a great buy so far.

As far as sound-canceling, they work well too.
The braided cord and plastic sheathing around the cord keeps them from getting tangled.
I have not fully submerged them yet, but I cant imagine it causing any harm if they are.
Overall, a great pair for the cheaper price.
Did not pick up a signal, very disappointing, as I live in a lower level apartment and have to keep the volume down.

Not as comfortable as some earlier models I have owned, but they work quite well.

This worked pretty well.
One thing is that they don't fit snugly in my ear holes and hence the room noise comes through.
It doesn't seem to like it when I am running.
As the phone moves, there is more noise.
Perhaps it has difficulty receiving the signal.
It's pretty good when you are not running and sitting at your table.
The turn on/off interface and bluetooth connection interface is easy and effective.

I can bend down and jump around with no issues.

I have not had any issues with battery life, even with bluetooth.
I admit that I wear a large hat size, but these earphones make me feel as if I am tring to use a child's toy.

Sound quality is excellent.

Forget Dre!
The only negative is the thick, curly cord straight from the '60s, but they offer a thin cord kit, and it is easy to install.
(Sennheiser does offer wireless headphones, at a premium price.)
Another caveat: does draw a bit of power from your phone (not as big a drain as iOS9), and your phone will drive lower volume through it than your earbuds or cheap Sony on-the-ears.
Just go to your music app's settings and adjust the EQ up about 25-30%.

As an avid runner this has been an amazing addition to my work out.

Linking to a smartphone was easy and the charge keeps for quite a long time.
This has been a hit with teenagers & adults alike and I have plans on gifting many to family members.

i bought this headset not from Amazon.

The problem with this is that it would easily fall off your ear if you try to look down or up while wearing this headphone.
This is mainly because both ear speaker muff easily folds flat 90 degrees to the front and 90 degree to the back.
So if you look down or look up.
the weight of the headphone will make the ear speaker fold out of your ear thus fall easily... the tube where it is attached has no clicking gear to keep it from rotating out of your ear.
Also headband adjustment is a little short and would not fit those people with big heads.
you have to center balance the headphone and have to not move abruptly or expect it fall off your head.
This headphone is only good in stationary position with no bending of head up or down.
Headphone ear muffs should not rotate forward but only in backward or should have somehow a mechanism to lock it or hold it tightly to desired position
I bought the white ones!

These lasted a little over a year (just long enough to be out of warranty) on my husband before the band snapped just above the left earphone, leaving it dangling by just a ribbon cable.

Upon further inspection after it snapped, the same area on the other side of the band was also stressed and about ready to break, and there were a couple cracks in the plastic closer to the center of the band as well.
This was after a year of pretty light use by my husband, maybe a few times a month while sitting or laying down in bed.
He ended up fixing it with epoxy, then heavily duct taping the whole band along with a couple sections of wire coat hanger to reinforce it.

The lights aren't overwhelmingly bright in a dark room but keeps night critters at bay, lol!
The sound quality is great and the noise cancellation works almost too well.

The only thing is when the speakers are on you have to turn the games ambiance down because everyone else chatting in TS can hear it too, which makes sense I suppose and really isn't a big deal.
Overall I love them and will probably get my husband a red pair!

First I just want to say wow.
These headphones are absolutely worth every single penny they cost.
The sound quality is stunning.
The wireless is impeccable.
Not to mention I picked the free shipping option (5-8 days) and got them in only 3.
They charge super fast and last for hours.
These headphones are extremely comfortable and cancel all other sounds out.
I am very very satisfied with this purchase and would recommend them to anyone.
Work great so far.
Cancel sound well and have a nice, rich bass sound for the money.
If you are serious about hearing music 'the way it was recorded' you will need a pair of these.
These are certainly targeted towards musicians and audio professionals make no mistake.

As I fit into that category I can say that
these definitely hold up to the hype, they are incredibly flat and unhyped.
If the original mix, recording and mastering were any good it will sound amazing on these phones, if this wasn't the case you will know almost straight away.

If you are just looking for new headphones from the casual listener camp just be advised that these might sound fairly strange at first, what you are hearing is music without the all too common frequency smile curve in which the lows and high are boosted and the mids scooped.
After a while though you might find you will come to appreciate the difference between great recordings and bad recordings a whole lot more!
